form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: A Century of Progress: A New Vision for the Future

full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/31/2023 FOIA (b)(6) SAV AND SE AND TOUNDER NORMAL REVENUE 2 ALABAMA AGRICULTURAL AND MECHANICAL UNIVERSITY NORMAL, ALABAMA 35762 DEPARTMENT OF BIOLOGY IMMIGRATION AND SERVICE January 23, 1976 GEORGIA FEB X 6 1976 A.M. 789 I-130 123456 Immigration Officer United States Department of Justice Immigration and Naturalization Service 1280 W. Peachtree Street, N. W. Atlanta, Georgia 30309 Dear Sir: This is in connection with the petition of immigration visa for my parents Mr. C. S. Pinjani and Mrs. S. B. Pinjani. I had petitioned for their visa on October 16, 1975. I had sent you a reminder on December 4, 1975. As of today (3 months and 1 week) I have recieved no reply as to the status of the petition. Ordinarily, the delay in the due process would not concern me, but FOIA (b)(6) In the light of the above circumstances, and the telephone conversation I have had with your office today at 10:30 a. m. Will you please give the pro- cessing of my petition your kind and prompt attention. FOIA (b)(6) FOIA (b)(6) Thank you and I hope to hear from you at your earliest convenience. Sincerely, Moti Purjain Moti Pinjani, D.V.M., Ph.D. Our Associate Professor MP/mh 100 th Enclosure: ANNIVERSARY A Century of Progress: A New Vision for the Future
